laoazhang

An Open Web advocate and front-end engineer, who loves everything mobile, and writes about HTML5, CSS, JS, UX, tech events, gadgets, etc. She unintentionally got 15min of fame by creating The HTTP Status Cats. Also, the opinions expressed here are solely her own and do not express the views or opinions of my employer.

Twitter Facebook LinkedIn Instagram Github

April 16, 2013

My Mobile HTML5 Talks Slides

I have been really busy, in an awesome way-

I have been working on a project called Coremob Camera, as a side project for W3C Core Mobile Web Platform CG (I will write more about the project later), and spoke about the project as Mobile Web: Real Life Examples of HTML5 for Mobile at W3Conf on Feb 22nd, then flew very next day to Barcelona for Mobile World Congress to join W3C to demo the Camera App.

Coming back home, and had another talk on HTML5 Mobile Approaches at Google DevFest Googleplex in Mountain View on March 15th, then I had done the HTML5 Use-Cases talk again at HTML5 Dev Conf in San Francisco. Each event gave me an amazing experience.

Anyway, if you would like to see my slide decks, the interactive HTML-version (the ones I actually used for the presentations) are available on github pages and the embeddable version and the PDFs are on speakerdeck.

I will give the updated talk on the open-sourced camera app at an event in Tokyo in June (TBD), and Oâ€™Reilly OSCON in Portland, OR on July 26th!
